title: ‘Insane, illegal, unconstitutional’: Mass. delegation responds to U.S. operation in Venezuela
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Politics The Democratic lawmakers have argued that the attack was not justified by federal or international law.
Protesters came out to a Massachusetts Peace Action rally protesting U.
S.

title: Anfernee Simons catches fire, leads Celtics to trap game win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics are now second in the Eastern Conference following their 115-101 win over the Bulls.
Boston Celtics guard Anfernee Simons, center, drives to the basket against Chicago Bulls center Lachlan Olbrich, right, during the second half on Monday, Jan.
5, 2026, in Boston.

title: Julian Edelman shares what has impressed him the most about Drake Maye
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He looks so confident, he makes it look so easy, and I think his relationship with Josh McDaniels has been awesome.
" Julian Edelman likes what he's seen from Drake Maye this season.
AP Photo/Steven Senne Drake Maye did more than just take a “second-year leap” with the Patriots in 2025.

title: Fraser Minten’s growth has been one of Bruins’ top victories this season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "He’s a Bruin through and through and he’s a guy that we want in our locker room.
And he’s going to carry this culture for a long time.
” Fraser Minten scored two goals in his return to Vancouver in Saturday.

title: Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh says 2025 Patriots team reminds him of this player
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Tough, gritty, physical, smart, fast.
They kind of like to hit like he liked to hit.
" Jim Harbaugh and the Chargers will take on the Patriots on Sunday.

title: Boston police officer on paid leave after domestic violence charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Ricardo Alexandre was placed on paid administrative leave after his arrest, a Boston police spokesperson confirmed.
He pleaded not guilty in court.
A Boston police officer.

title: 3 Mass. children have died from flu this season, DPH says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Health Health officials say it's not too late to get vaccinated after 30 adults and three children have died amid the state's early surge of flu cases.
A nurse prepares an injection of the influenza vaccine at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston, Massachusetts.
Reuters/Brian Snyder/File ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Devin McCourty: Chargers rested starters because they ‘wanted’ Patriots in playoffs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "The Patriots don’t have a great pass rush, the Chargers are a little weak up front, I think they like that matchup.
” Devin McCourty believes the Chargers welcomed a first-round matchup with the Patriots.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe With their shot at winning the AFC West no longer on the table last weekend, Jim Harbaugh and the Los Angeles Chargers opted to rest their starters in Week 18 against the Denver Broncos — headlined by star QB Justin Herbert.

title: Bruins’ banged-up blue line gets more bad news with Hampus Lindholm
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “It’s not going to be a day-to-day thing.
" Hampus Lindholm is going on the shelf due to injury.
(AP Photo/David Zalubowski) The Bruins’ blue line has taken another hit ahead of the final game of their five-game road trip.

title: ‘This league is abut winning:’ Drake Maye pitches his own case for winning MVP
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I think this league is about winning and then from there the ability to spread the ball around and get teammates involved.
" Drake Maye AP Photo/Charles Krupa Patriots coach Mike Vrabel laid out his opinion on the matter while speaking to reporters on Monday.
He praised Maye for his accuracy, ability to create explosive plays, and willingness to use his legs to extend plays.
